question: what is panadol used for
answer:
**PANADOL (Paracetamol 500mg)**

**Uses:**
• Relieves mild to moderate pain
• Reduces fever
• Headaches, toothaches, muscle aches

**Dosage:**
• Adults: 1-2 tablets every 4-6 hours
• Maximum: 8 tablets in 24 hours
• Take with or without food

**Safe for:** Pregnant women, children (syrup form)
**Not for:** Liver disease patients

question: panadol side effects
answer:
**PANADOL Side Effects:**

**Common (Rare):**
• Nausea
• Skin rash (allergic reaction)

**Serious (Very Rare):**
• Liver damage (if overdose)
• Allergic reactions

**Safety:**
✅ Very safe when used as directed
⚠️ NEVER exceed 4 grams (8 tablets) per day
⚠️ Avoid alcohol while taking
⚠️ Don't combine with other paracetamol products

question: can i take panadol during pregnancy
answer:
**PANADOL During Pregnancy:**

✅ **SAFE** - Panadol is considered safe during all trimesters of pregnancy

**Guidelines:**
• Use lowest effective dose
• Take for shortest duration needed
• Maximum 4 grams per day
• Consult doctor if using frequently

**Always consult your obstetrician** before taking any medication during pregnancy.

question: augmentin antibiotic uses
answer:
**AUGMENTIN (Amoxicillin + Clavulanic Acid)**

**Uses:**
• Respiratory infections (pneumonia, bronchitis)
• Ear infections
• Sinus infections
• Urinary tract infections
• Skin infections

**Dosage:**
• 625mg: 1 tablet twice daily
• 1g: 1 tablet twice daily
• Take with food
• Complete full course (usually 5-7 days)

⚠️ **PRESCRIPTION REQUIRED** - Must be prescribed by doctor

question: augmentin side effects
answer:
**AUGMENTIN Side Effects:**

**Common:**
• Diarrhea (10-25% of users)
• Nausea
• Stomach upset
• Vaginal yeast infection

**Less Common:**
• Skin rash
• Headache

**Rare but Serious:**
• Severe allergic reaction
• Liver problems
• Bloody diarrhea (stop immediately)

**Tips:**
• Take with food to reduce stomach upset
• Eat yogurt to prevent diarrhea
• Complete full course

question: brufen vs panadol which is better
variations: should i take brufen or panadol
answer:
**BRUFEN vs PANADOL Comparison:**

**PANADOL (Paracetamol):**
• Better for: Fever, mild pain
• Safer for: Stomach, liver (if used correctly)
• Can take: During pregnancy
• Side effects: Very few

**BRUFEN (Ibuprofen):**
• Better for: Inflammation, muscle pain, dental pain
• Anti-inflammatory: Yes
• Avoid: Stomach ulcers, kidney disease
• Take with: Food

**Can take both together** (consult doctor for severe pain)

**Choose PANADOL** for fever/simple pain
**Choose BRUFEN** for inflammatory pain

question: calpol dosage for children
answer:
**CALPOL SYRUP Dosage (120mg/5ml):**

**By Age:**
• 3-6 months: 2.5ml
• 6-24 months: 5ml
• 2-4 years: 7.5ml
• 4-6 years: 10ml
• 6-12 years: 10-15ml

**Frequency:**
• Every 4-6 hours as needed
• Maximum: 4 doses in 24 hours
• Give with or without food

**Important:**
• Use measuring syringe provided
• Shake bottle before use
• If under 3 months, consult doctor
• If fever persists >3 days, see pediatrician

question: vitamin d deficiency symptoms
variations: how to know vitamin d low
answer:
**Vitamin D Deficiency Symptoms:**

**Common Signs:**
• Fatigue and tiredness
• Bone pain, muscle weakness
• Frequent infections
• Slow wound healing
• Depression, mood changes
• Hair loss

**Risk Factors:**
• Limited sun exposure
• Dark skin
• Obesity
• Age >50
• Living in northern regions

**Solution:**
• **VITAMIN D3** supplements (1000-2000 IU daily)
• Sun exposure (15-20 min daily)
• Eat: Fish, eggs, fortified milk

**Get tested** - Blood test to confirm deficiency

question: dettol antiseptic how to use
answer:
**DETTOL ANTISEPTIC LIQUID Uses:**

**For Wounds:**
• Dilute 1 part Dettol to 20 parts water (1:20)
• Clean wound with diluted solution
• Apply bandage if needed

**For Surface Cleaning:**
• Dilute 1 capful in 1 liter water
• Wipe surfaces

**For Bathing (Antiseptic bath):**
• Add 2-3 capfuls to bath water
• Good for skin infections

**⚠️ NEVER:**
• Drink or ingest
• Use undiluted on skin
• Use in eyes
• Use on large open wounds without diluting

question: omeprazole for acidity
answer:
**OMEPRAZOLE (20mg/40mg)**

**Uses:**
• Acid reflux (GERD)
• Heartburn
• Stomach ulcers
• Preventing ulcers from NSAIDs

**Dosage:**
• 20mg once daily (morning, before food)
• 40mg for severe cases
• Take 30 minutes before breakfast

**Duration:**
• Short-term: 2-4 weeks
• Long-term: Only with doctor's advice

**⚠️ Important:**
• Don't use >14 days without consulting doctor
• Take before meals (empty stomach)
• May reduce calcium absorption (take calcium supplement)

question: how many medicines do you stock
answer: We currently stock over **2,429+ registered medicines** and healthcare products. Our catalog includes everything from daily OTC products like Panadol to specialized prescription-only medications and cold-chain items like vaccines.

question: cold chain storage details
answer:
**Our Advanced Cold Chain Protocol:**

• **Frozen Zone:** -80°C to -20°C (for specialized vaccines).
• **Fridge Zone:** 2°C to 8°C (for insulin and common vaccines).
• **Room Temp:** 15°C to 25°C (standard pharmaceutical storage).
• **Monitoring:** 24/7 digital temperature tracking with backup power systems.
• **Transport:** Medicines are shipped in specialized clinical boxes with real-time temperature monitors to ensure they are **Always Safe**.
